meta.content: Front Page; New York and Region
meta.name: online_sections

block.p: Hello, Hi, Greetings, Good Day, Yo, What's Up? Michael Britto, a filmmaker, has spent the last year documenting the hundreds of different handshakes used each day on the streets of New York. From left are the Tiger Claw, the Cherokee-Apache and the Taliban.

Europe Backs Russia For Entry to W.T.O. Russia, with the last big economy outside the World Trade Organization, won support for membership in the group from the European Union and subsequently said it would support the environmental treaty on global warming known as the Kyoto Protocol.

Russia signed a trade deal with European officials in a political victory for President Vladimir V. Putin. Russia's last remaining major hurdle to joining the W.T.O. is an agreement with the United States.

Hello, Hi, Greetings, Good Day, Yo, What's Up? Michael Britto, a filmmaker, has spent the last year documenting the hundreds of different handshakes used each day on the streets of New York. From left are the Tiger Claw, the Cherokee-Apache and the Taliban.

Europe Backs Russia For Entry to W.T.O. Russia, with the last big economy outside the World Trade Organization, won support for membership in the group from the European Union and subsequently said it would support the environmental treaty on global warming known as the Kyoto Protocol.

Russia signed a trade deal with European officials in a political victory for President Vladimir V. Putin. Russia's last remaining major hurdle to joining the W.T.O. is an agreement with the United States.

Lakers Take Game 1 The Los Angeles Lakers took away the Minnesota Timberwolves' home-court advantage by winning the first game of their Western Conference final series, 97-88. Shaquille O'Neal had 27 points and 18 rebounds.

Upgrade for California California's credit rating was raised a notch by Moody's Investors Service, though it is still the lowest among the states. An analyst for the company said the political climate had improved under Gov. Arnold Schwarzenegger.

Saudis to Pump More Oil In an effort to drive down record crude oil prices, Saudi Arabia, the world's largest oil producer, offered to increase its output by at least 500,000 barrels, to 9 million barrels a day.

On TV, No Summer Vacation The breakdown of the fall-to-spring, 35-week television ''year'' is accelerating as two major networks drastically change how they roll out their shows. NBC is moving up its schedule nearly a month. On Fox, the new season starts on June 8.
